definitions.definition: to risk money on the result of an event or a competition, such as a horse race, in the hope of winning more money:
examples: He regularly goes to the races and bets heavily.

definitions.definition: If you say you bet (someone) that something is true or will happen, you mean you are certain that it is true or will happen:
examples: [ + (that) ] I bet you (that) she's missed the bus.

definitions.definition: an amount of money that you risk on the result of an event or a competition, such as a horse race:
examples: She had a bet on the race.
[ + (that) ] My bet is (that) their baby will be a girl.
